alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Clay; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mason, eastern Cabell, Kanawha, Putnam, northeastern Lincoln, west central Clay and northwestern Boone Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 822 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Winfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Winfield, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Sissonville, Milton, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Buffalo, Clendenin and Poca. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 117. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 16 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 86 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 43 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western and northwestern West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, southern, western and north central West Virginia.
